content:
• Tuesday, May 14, 2019
  • LM

    Trian may wage proxy fight at Legg Mason - WSJ

    • Legg Mason (NYSE:LM) +2.3% after-hours following a WSJ report that says Trian Fund Management may wage an activist campaign at the money manager in a push to improve weak results.
    • Trian recently held talks with LM management about the need to cut costs and improve profit margins, according to the report, which also says the two sides may still work out a deal that avoids a proxy fight.
    • Trian previously owned LM shares during 2009-16 and CEO Nelson Peltz sat on its board before departing in 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 PM
  • TWNK

    Hostess -1.7% on holder's 8M-share offering

    • Hostess Brands (NASDAQ:TWNK) is 1.7% lower postmarket following a filing by affiliates of C. Dean Metropoulos to offer 8M shares of common stock.
    • The company's not selling any shares and won't receive any proceeds.
    • That offering is set to come at $13.40-$13.60/share, according to Bloomberg; TWNK closed at $13.79 today.
    • JPMorgan will offer the shares from time to time.
    • Metropoulos plans to use proceeds for philanthropic commitments among other uses.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar -6.2% as it proposes 3.75M-share offering of ADS

    • JinkoSolar (NYSE:JKS) is 6.2% lower after hours after proposing a follow-on offering of 3.75M American Depositary Shares.
    • Those ADS are said to come at $16 each, Bloomberg reports; JKS closed at $17.69 after gaining 1.8% during the regular session.
    • The company's also launching a concurrent private placement of up to $85M in convertible senior notes due 2024; the offerings aren't contingent upon one another.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 20 Comments
  • ENT

    Global Eagle beats top-line consensus, names CFO; shares +39%

    • Global Eagle Entertainment (NASDAQ:ENT) has jumped 39.3% after an earnings report where underlying earnings topped high-end Street estimates and revenues beat expectations.
    • It's also named Christian Mezger its new chief financial officer. He was most recently CEO at Ciber and had previously worked at Hewlett Packard; he succeeds Paul Rainey, who's staying to aid the transition through May 31.
    • The company's considering divesting various businesses and assets, including potentially selling elements of its Maritime, Enterprise and Government business unit. It's retained Barclays Capital as adviser and may sell out of joint ventures as well.
    • Revenue grew 6.5% to $167M, with increases both in Media & Content and in Connectivity.
    • Gross margin was up to 19.5%, and it trimmed net loss to $37.6M amid some cost savings.
    • EBITDA rose 7% to $18.5M.
    • Liquidity was $50.7M; first-quarter capex was about $4.2M.
    • Previously: Global Eagle Entertainment misses by $0.02, beats on revenue (May. 14 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM

  • A, ACB, EGHT and TLRY among notable after hour movers

    • Gainers: TCS +13.2%. TLRY +4.9%. HEXO +4.2%. ACB +2.8%. HCM +1.8%.
    • Losers: A -9.3%. EGHT -6.2%. JKS -5.9%VIRT -5.7%. NEWR -4.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 30 Comments
  • WYY

    WidePoint -4.6% as revenues fall short despite swing to profit

    • WidePoint (NYSEMKT:WYY) has fallen 4.6% after hours following a miss on revenues in its Q1 earnings report, though the company recorded its first GAAP profit in almost six years.
    • Revenues grew 9%, and gross profit was up 20%, to $4.3M.
    • EBITDA was positive for the seventh straight quarter, at $1M.
    • Meanwhile the company swung to a gain of $0.4M from a year-ago loss of $0.5M, as it cut expenses to go along with the revenue increase.
    • “We remain optimistic about the remainder of 2019 and beyond, and we look forward to continuing with our strategy to more aggressively grow the topline while improving our margins, improving profitability and returning greater value to our supportive shareholders," says CEO Jin Kang.
    • For the year, it's reiterating guidance for revenue growth of 8-12% (to $90M-$93M). It's boosting EBITDA guidance to $2.75M-$3.5M.
    • Previously: WidePoint misses on revenue (May. 14 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • NEWR

    New Relic -4.6% on light profit guidance

    • New Relic (NYSE:NEWR) has slipped 4.6% postmarket after a Q4 report where it topped consensus but guided to the light side for profits for the current quarter and year.
    • Revenues grew 34.2% and gross profit grew 34.5%, to $110.4M.
    • But operating expenses rose 40% and operating loss widened to $15.4M from $7.5M. Net loss grew to $17.4M from a loss of $6.97M.
    • The company notes it had 858 paid business accounts of $100K-0lus, vs. 703 a year ago, and that it saw 61% of annual recurring revenue from Enterprise Paid Business Accounts vs. a year-ago 54%.
    • Liquidity was $744.7M, vs. $722.3M last quarter.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenue of $138M-$140M (vs. $138.6M consensus) and EPS of $0.07-$0.08 (light of expectations for $0.19).
    • For the full year, it forecasts revenue of $600M-$607M (vs. $601.7M consensus) and EPS of $0.54-$0.62 (below expectations for $0.86).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: New Relic beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (May. 14 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tankers beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Nordic American Tankers (NYSE:NAT): Q1 GAAP EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $53.63M (+81.1% Y/Y) beats by $3.89M.
    • Shares +1.36%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 7 Comments
  • DOX

    Amdocs beats by $0.03, revenue in-line

    • Amdocs (NASDAQ:DOX): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.06 beats by $0.03; GAAP EPS of $0.90 beats by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $1.02B (+2.8% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Shares +2.9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • TLRY

    Tilray up 7% after hours on Q1 revenue beat

    • Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY) Q1 results ($M): Total cannabis revenues: 23.0 (+195.1%); adult-use: 7.9; direct to patient & bulk: 7.8 (+5.2%); food products: 5.6; international - medical: 1.8 (+321.2%).
    • 3,012 kg equivalents sold (+131.9%).
    • Net loss: (30.3) (-482.7%); loss/share: (0.32) (-357.1%).
    • Non-GAAP net loss: (25.2) (-384.6%); non-GAAP loss/share: (0.27) (-285.7%).
    • Shares up 7% after hours.
    • Previously: Tilray misses by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 38 Comments
  • TCS

    The Container Store +10% after earnings topper

    • The Container Store (NYSE:TCS) reports comparable sales increased 8.5% in Q1 on broad-based gains across the core custom closets business and other product categories. The rate smashed the consensus estimate of +3.1%.
    • Adjusted EBITDA came in at $37.8M vs. $31.1.M a year ago vs. $36M a year ago.
    • Gross margin was level with last year's mark of 58.6% of sales.
    • Looking ahead, Container Store expects revenue of $915M to $925M vs. $910M consensus and EPS of $0.41 to $0.51 vs. $0.45 consensus.
    • TCS +9.65% AH.
    • Previously: The Container Store beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • A

    Agilent down 8% after hours on FQ2 miss, revenue guidance cut

    • Agilent (NYSE:A) fiscal Q2 results ($M): Revenue: 1,238 (+2.7%).
    • Net income: 182 (-16.1%); non-GAAP net income: 228 (+7.5%); EPS: 0.57 (-7.9%) non-GAAP EPS: 0.71 (+9.2%).
    • Cash flow ops (6 mo.): 465 (-10.2%).
    • Fiscal Q3 guidance: Revenue: $1.225B - 1.245B; non-GAAP EPS: $0.71 - 0.73.
    • Fiscal 2019 guidance: Revenue: $5.085B - 5.125B from $5.15B - 5.19B; non-GAAP EPS: $3.03 - 3.07 (unch).
    • Shares down 8% after hours.
    • Previously: Agilent misses by $0.01, misses on revenue (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • TLRY

    Tilray misses by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.01; GAAP EPS of -$0.32 misses by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $23.04M (+195.4% Y/Y) beats by $2.52M.
    • Shares +4.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 13 Comments
  • UBER

    Federal board says Uber drivers are contractors

    • The U.S. National Labor Relations Board decided on Uber (NYSE:UBER) drivers last month, according to a newly released memo via Bloomberg Law.
    • Key quote: “On any given day, at any free moment, UberX drivers could decide how best to serve their economic objectives: by fulfilling ride requests through the App, working for a competing rideshare service, or pursuing a different venture altogether. The surge pricing and other financial incentives Uber utilized to meet rider demand not only reflect Uber’s “hands off” approach, they also constituted a further entrepreneurial opportunity for drivers.”
    • The board is the second federal agency, following the Department of Labor, to say Uber drivers aren't employees entitled to minimum wage and overtime pay.
    • Uber shares are up 6.2% to $39.40.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 35 Comments
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor launches new hotel safety features

    • TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) announces a safety strategy that includes a way for travelers to filter results based on whether a location has safety complaints and a flag on reviews discussing safety violations to make them easier to spot.
    • The company has long faced complaints about deleting reviews referring to assaults or robberies for violating the site's guidelines.
    • TripAdvisor responded with a warning system that placed a digital badge on the page of hotels receiving complaints, but the system wasn't sufficient.
    • TRIP shares are up 2.2% to $46.99.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • ABC

    AmerisourceBergen gains on takeover thesis

    • Drug wholesaler AmerisourceBergen (ABC +1.7%) is up on average volume in apparent response to a note from Raymond James analyst John Ransom that it could be a potential acquisition target by Walgreens Boot Alliance (WBA +1.7%) considering the latter's lack of recent deals and its 27% stake in ABC.
    • He also mentions LabCorp (LH +2%) as another enticing target, offering more upside than ABC with lower risk (opioid-related litigation) but with less financial benefit. WBA is in a joint venture with the lab services provider to open at least 600 LabCorp patient service centers at Walgreens stores over the next four years.
    • He opines that ABC could go for $95/share and LH for $200.
    • Related tickers: McKesson (MCK +0.1%); Cardinal Health (CAH +0.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 12 Comments
  • STMP

    Stamps.com +1.6% on Army contract

    • Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP) gains 1.6% after a U.S. Army contract awarded in April appeared on the FBO website.
    • Under the contract, Stamps will continue to provide postage stamp subscription services.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 13 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: Maxar Technologies (NYSE:MAXR) +20%. Luokung Technology (NASDAQ:LKCO) +15%. Support.com (NASDAQ:SPRT) +14%. Gravity (NASDAQ:GRVY) +11%. Digimarc Corporation (NASDAQ:DMRC) +9%.

    • Gainers: Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +21%. Chaparral Energy (NYSE:CHAP) +12%. U.S. Gold (NASDAQ:USAU) +10%. Superior Energy Services (NYSE:SPN) +10%. SAExploration Holdings (NASDAQ:SAEX) +9%.
    • Losers: Westwater Resources (NASDAQ:WWR) -10%. Americas Silver (NYSEMKT:USAS) -7%. Gold Resource (NYSEMKT:GORO) -7%. McEwen Mining (NYSE:MUX) -6%. Contango Oil & Gas (NYSEMKT:MCF) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • DGLY

    Digital Ally -25% after patent settlement

    • Digital Ally (NASDAQ:DGLY) plunges 25% after reaching an agreement that has WatchGuard paying DGLY $6M, Digital Ally will give WatchGuard a license to the two patents, and the case will be dropped.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • INTC

    Intel patches ZombieLoad chip flaw

    • Security researchers found a new class of Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) chip flaw dubbed ZombieLoad, which is made up of four bugs, affects nearly all Intel chips going back to 2011, and can allow a hacker to access sensitive data straight from the processor.
    • AMD and ARM aren't vulnerable to this attack.
    • The researchers informed Intel, which released microcode to patch the vulnerable processors. Consumer PC and device makers including Microsoft and Google are also issuing patches to serve as an initial defense.
    • Intel tells TechCrunch that its patches could slow processors as much as 3% (consumer) to 9% (data center) but says the difference shouldn't be noticeable in most situations.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 92 Comments
  • MEET

    Meet Group +4% as Aegis enters bullish

    • Aegis starts Meet Group (NASDAQ:MEET) at Buy with a $6.25 target, a 45% upside.
    • Last week, Meet reported Q1 beats with downside Q2 revenue outlook.
    • MEET shares are up 4.2% to $4.26.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM

  • Sirius International Insurance leads financial gainers; Mmtec and U.S. Global Investors among losers

    • Gainers: Sirius International Insurance Group (NASDAQ:SG) +13%. PPDAI Group (NYSE:PPDF) +10%. Camping World Holdings (NYSE:CWH) +8%. eXp World Holdings (NASDAQ:EXPI) +7%. Yirendai (NYSE:YRD) +6%.
    • Losers: LM Funding America (NASDAQ:LMFA) -6%. Mmtec (NASDAQ:MTC) -6%. CBL & Associates Properties (NYSE:CBL) -5%. U.S. Global Investors (NASDAQ:GROW) -5%.

  • AeroVironment leads industrial gainers; Fuel Tech tops the losers

    • Gainers: AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) +11%. Construction Partners (NASDAQ:ROAD) +8%. Coda Octopus Group (NASDAQ:CODA) +7%. CUI Global (NASDAQ:CUI) +6%. U.S. Well Services (NASDAQ:USWS) +6%.

    | 1:01 PM
  • CMCSA

    FreeWheel enhances OTT programmatic-ad buying

    • Comcast's FreeWheel (CMCSA +2.3%) has announced new programmatic-ad over-the-top buying capabilities for agencies and advertisers.
    • Some 1,200-plus agencies use the Strata platform for buying, and end-to-end buying opens up access to the OTT marketplace for all clients there, FreeWheel says.
    • That removes some key barriers for mid-sized and independent media buying agencies, such as minimum spend levels usually enforced by demand-side platforms.
    • FreeWheel Advertisers will extend the local programmatic OTT offering to all forms of TV starting in the second half.
    • Previously: Comcast selling Hulu stake to Disney in five years (May. 14 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM

  • Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Big 5 Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV) +26%. Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX) +25%. Asta Funding (NASDAQ:ASFI) +20%. MeiraGTx Holdings (NASDAQ:MGTX) +19%. Luokung Technology (NASDAQ:LKCO) +18%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +17%. Verastem (NASDAQ:VSTM) +17%. Support.com (NASDAQ:SPRT) +15%. Maxar Technologies (NYSE:MAXR) +14%. Sirius International Insurance Group (NASDAQ:SG) +13%.
    • Losers: Inuvo (NYSEMKT:INUV) -38%. Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK) -37%. Solid Biosciences (NASDAQ:SLDB) -29%. Myovant Sciences (NYSE:MYOV) -27%. Digital Ally (NASDAQ:DGLY) -26%. Iconix Brand Group (NASDAQ:ICON) -20%. InspireMD (NYSEMKT:NSPR) -19%. BSQUARE Corporation (NASDAQ:BSQR) -18%. Crown Crafts (NASDAQ:CRWS) -18%. FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 5 Comments
  • FTSV

    Forty Seven down 10% after Q1 report

    • Thinly traded Forty Seven (FTSV -9.9%) is down on average volume after posting Q1 results after the close yesterday. Since it has no product sales yet, upcoming events/catalysts merit mention.
    • Upcoming presentations:
    • Phase 1b/2 data on lead candidate 5F9, combined with Roche's Rituxan (rituximab), in patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma at the European Hematology Association and International Conference on Malignant Lymphoma events in June.
    • Phase 1b data on 5F9, alone and with Celgene's Vidaza (azacitidine), in AML and MDS at ASCO in early June.
    • 5F9 is a CD47-targeting monoclonal antibody.
    • Key milestones:
    • H2: Preclinical and IND-enabling data on FSI-174 as a conditioning regimen for bone marrow transplantation. Complete IND-enabling studies for FSI-189.
    • Q4: Phase 1b data on 5F9, combined with Pfizer's Bavencio (avelumab), in ovarian cancer. Phase 1b data on 5F9, combined with Eli Lilly's Erbitux (cetuximab), in colorectal cancer.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • COF

    Capital One +2.4% as Jefferies notes `positive narrative'

    • Capital One (NYSE:COF) shares gets a 2.4% boost after Jefferies analyst John Hecht upgrades the credit-card issuer to buy, citing its "positive narrative," partly due to its superior digital bank capabilities and user experience.
    • Hecht also sees improving efficiency helping COF.
    • Separately, Hecht expects COF, American Express (AXP +1.3%), Discover Financial (DFS +1.8%), and Synchrony Financial (SYF +2.5%) credit-card April master trust reports to show delinquencies declining and charge-offs mixed.
    • Capital One sell-side analyst ratings; quant ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 5 Comments
  • ALLT

    Allot +3.4% as it shrinks losses in Q1

    • Allot (NASDAQ:ALLT) is up 3.4% following its Q1 earnings report, where it edged expectations by narrowing losses all around amid continuing double-digit revenue growth.
    • Gross profit of $18.3M grew 21%, and gross margin improved to 72.4% from a year-ago 69.6%.
    • Meanwhile operating loss improved to $1.8M from a prior-year loss of $2.3M, and net loss (non-GAAP) shrank to $1.9M from a loss of $2.4M.
    • Cash and investments were $101.5M vs. $103.9M at 2018's end.
    • It's reiterated full-year guidance for revenues of $106M-$110M and book-to-bill ratio above 1. Management has a goal to sign security OPEX deals with aggregate maximum annual revenue of $100M.
    • Previously: Allot Communications beats by $0.01, revenue in-line (May. 14 2019)
    • Previously: Allot to partner with Rakuten Mobile (May. 14 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • LM

    Legg Mason +4.0% Q4 impresses as fund flows improve

    • Legg Mason (NYSE:LM) jumps 4.0% after reporting better-than-expected fiscal Q4 earnings.
    • RBC analyst Kenneth Lee notes April fund flows are "trending positive"; he sees the company's updated restructuring plan achieving cost savings with two years.
    • Fixed income is largely driving improved fund flows, Lee writes.
    • Maintains outperform recommendation; boosts price target to $39 from $35.
    • Sell-side ratings; quant ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • WINMQ

    Windstream employee incentives win court approval

    • Key employee incentive/retention programs at Windstream (WINMQ -2.6%) have been approved by a judge in its bankruptcy proceedings, Bloomberg reports.
    • The U.S. Trustee objected to the programs, saying the key program allocated just $3.8M of the $5M earmarked for non-insiders and the balance could go to insiders/officers, and that executive performance targets were too low.
    • But judge Robert Drain ruled that the programs were in line with industry standards and the employees were necessary for ongoing operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 13 Comments
  • NVAX

    Bargain hunters jump into Novavax, up 28%

    • The dramatic selloff in Novavax (NVAX +27.8%), shares had lost 88% of their value since early February before today's action, appears to have reached an attractive level for bargain hunters. The stock is up on more than a 4x surge in volume on no particular news other than a recent 1:20 reverse stock split.
    • Shares plummeted in February after RSV vaccine candidate ResVax failed to beat placebo in a late-stage study.
    • On the working capital front, at the end of March it had ~$100M in quick assets while operations consumed ~$51M in Q1.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 8 Comments

  • Intelsat +4.6% as FCC's O'Rielly pushes mid-band reallocation

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) is up another 4.6% today as its push for monetizing mid-band spectrum picks up some regulatory steam.
    • Yesterday, a pair of key senators wrote to the FCC pushing for quick action on freeing up spectrum in the 3.7 GHz to 4.2 GHz band for use by wireless carriers in 5G deployment. Intelsat shares rose in response.
    • Now FCC Commissioner Michael O'Rielly is set to testify that action on the spectrum is "highest priority," saying that companies may need more airwaves for 5G than they're currently proposing.
    • O'Rielly is part of the Republican majority at the FCC, suggesting the issue is moving up the agenda there. He's urging "quickest reallocation" of that spectrum for wireless use.
    • Intelsat and its partners in the C-Band Alliance, including SES (OTCPK:SGBAF) and Intel (INTC +1.1%) have been pressing a plan to monetize that spectrum by re-pointing it toward 5G use.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 7 Comments
  • XLF

    Financials bounce back after a blue Monday

    • Financials, among the worst-performing stocks on Monday, regain some ground on Tuesday.
    • The Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (NYSEARCA:XLF) rises 1.4% compared with its 2.9% decline yesterday and the SPDR S&P Regional Banking ETF (NYSEARCA:KRE) also gains 1.4% vs. a 4.1% descent in the previous session.
    • Among the big banks, Bank of America (BAC +2.1%) and  Citigroup (C +1.9%) rebound the strongest, followed by JPMorgan (JPM +1.8%), Goldman Sachs (GS +1.4%), Wells Fargo (WFC +0.8%), and Morgan Stanley (MS +0.5%).
    • For regional banks, Comerica (CMA +1.8%), KeyCorp (KEY +2.1%), and CIT Group (CIT +2.2%) log in the strongest gains. Others: Regions Financial (RF +1.4%), PNC Financial (PNC +1.4%), Fifth Third (FITB +1.5%), Huntington Bancshares (HBAN +1.4%).
    • Credit-card financial institutions make an impressive comeback: Synchrony Financial (SYF +2.4%), Alliance Data (ADS +2.1%), Capital One (COF +2.2%), Discover Financial (DFS +1.7%), American Express (AXP +1.2%).
    • Life insurers also notch up gains: Brighthouse Financial (BHF +3.5%), Prudential Financial (PRU +2.5%), Principal Financial (PFG +2.1%), and MetLife (MET +2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 12 Comments
  • DHXM

    DHX Media slides 6.1% post Q3 results

    • DHX Media (DHXM -6.1%) reported Q3 revenue of C$110M, a decrease of 5.6% Y/Y.
    • Distribution revenue grew sequentially by 51% Q/Q to C$20.7M and Consumer products-owned revenue grew 10% Y/Y to C$37.5M, driven by Peanuts.
    • Wildbrain revenue grew by 4% Y/Y to C$14.9M and views increased 15% to more than 8.7B.
    • Q3 Gross margin declined 100 bps to 43%.
    • Adj. EBITDA was C$20.1M (-24.7% Y/Y), decline was partly due to an increase in the non-controlling interest in Peanuts, primarily related to the Sony transaction; and margin declined by 465 bps to 18.3%.
    • Company signed an agreement with Comcast in the US to debut our new subscription-based video-on-demand service, called Kids Room, on Xfinity X1 and Xfinity Flex.
    • The Company's debt leverage ratio was 6.09x at Q3 2019.
    • Also, announced an agreement to sell a building in Toronto owned by the Company for C$12M which net proceeds will be used for debt repayment.
    • Previously: DHX Media reports Q3 results (May. 14 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM

  • Kandi Technologies and Navistar International among consumer gainers; Iconix Brand Group leads the losers

    • Gainers: Lifeway Foods (NASDAQ:LWAY) +12%. Beyond Meat (NASDAQ:BYND) +10%. Pyxus International (NYSE:PYX) +9%. Kandi Technologies (NASDAQ:KNDI) +8%. Navistar International (NYSE:NAV) +7%.
    • Losers: Iconix Brand Group (NASDAQ:ICON) -16%. Crown Crafts (NASDAQ:CRWS) -9%. Limoneira (NASDAQ:LMNR) -6%. National Beverage (NASDAQ:FIZZ) -6%. Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • LIQT

    More on LiqTech's Q1 results; shares +2.9%

    • LiqTech International (LIQT +2.9%) reported Q1 revenue growth of 210.5% Y/Y to $7.4M. Company sees continuing growth in demand of ceramic silicon carbide water filtration systems for marine scrubber applications.
    • Q1 Gross margin recovered by 2,237 bps to 19.9%, reflects increased sales of higher-margin marine products and positive operating leverage from increased plant utilization.
    • Q1 income from operations was $17.46k, compared to loss from operations of $1.4M a year ago.
    • Total operating expenses were $1.46M (+8.7% Y/Y); with selling expenses of $483.6k (+18% Y/Y); G&A of $770.8k (+1.1% Y/Y); and R&D of $203.2k (+19.9% Y/Y).
    • Cash on hand and restricted cash was $2.6M, as of March 31, 2019.
    • Company says 2Q19 revenue is expected to increase more than 20% sequentially due to continued momentum in scrubber sales.
    • Previously: LiqTech misses by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM

  • PTGX

    Protagonist IBD candidate shows positive action in early-stage study; shares up 2%

    • Protagonist Therapeutics (PTGX +1.5%) is up on below-average volume following its announcement of results from the single-ascending dose part of a Phase 1 clinical trial of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) candidate PN-943.
    • Testing in healthy volunteers showed a favorable safety profile with no serious adverse effects reported. Pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic measures were consistent with expectations.
    • Data from the multiple-ascending dose part should be available next quarter. The results will inform on the design of a Phase 2 trial in ulcerative colitis.
    • The company replaced candidate PTG-100 with PN-943, an oral gut-restricted alpha4beta7 integrin-specific antagonist, after it demonstrated greater potency.
    • Alpha4beta7 is an adhesion molecule that plays a key role in controlling the migration of pro-inflammatory T cells to the intestine. Specifically, it binds to a protein called MAdCAM-1 which "directs" T cells into the intestinal tract. Binding to MAdCAM-1, also known as addressin, lessens inflammation since fewer T cells travel to the intestine.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM

  • NBCU streaming plans: More 'cord' than cord-cutting

    • Between upfronts yesterday and Comcast's (CMCSA +1.7%) deal to get out of its stake in Hulu, more details are emerging about the shape of a planned NBCUniversal streaming service.
    • For one, it's going to be much more friendly to the traditional cable model than to radical cord-cutting. Its full service (including current-season shows and live TV) will only be available to pay TV subscribers, a la today's "TV Everywhere" model, for free, Alex Sherman notes.
    • Paid subscribers to the streaming service who aren't cable subscribers will be able to watch only older seasons of TV shows on demand.
    • And Comcast had wanted to price the streaming service around $12/month -- before Disney Plus (DIS +1.9%) set up at $6.99/month. Now Comcast is looking more toward $10/month for the paid version of its service.
    • A put/call agreement addressing future capital calls ensures that Comcast will get no less than $5.8B for its third of Hulu, though that amount could rise if Hulu gets more valuable over the next five years.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 17 Comments

  • Comcast selling Hulu stake to Disney in five years

    • Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) has agreed to sell out of its stake in Hulu in five years, CNBC reports, though it will give up the voting rights immediately.
    • That means Disney (NYSE:DIS) will hold total control of the streaming service, after having outlasted three other venture partners: It bought out Fox's share (FOX, FOXA), and WarnerMedia (NYSE:T) sold its 10% back to Hulu, leaving Comcast as the only non-Disney holder.
    • Comcast could sell its remaining stake at a total-company valuation of $27.5B or whatever Hulu is appraised at in five years.
    • Disney will pay Comcast for its Hulu content for that time period.
    • And NBC channels will be on Hulu Live at a higher rate than in the previous agreement, while NBC will be able to run the same content on its own streaming platform, expected next spring.
    • Disney is up 1.6% premarket.
    • Updated: Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 74 Comments
